title: Champion mastery not working?
body:
I was just wondering with the champion mastery, it is implied that once you reach crests 4/5 you will be rewarded with:
Custom emote (what is this?)
Loading screen badge 
Announcement banner 
Role tile 
i just reached crest 4 with Azir, but in the games afterward there was no loading screen badge, (i dont know what a custom emote and an announcement banner are, so i dont know if i have that but nothing seems different anywhere so i dont think so,) i do however have a new role title so the system has recognised that i am at crest 4, i just dont have any of the other stuff which is kinda disappointing as i was looking forward to what i saw in the "champion mastery is live!" page
also on that page it shows the crest actually in game above LB, Lee, Wukong and Xin's heads and yet i have never seen this on anyone even myself and even after i reached crest 4 
so i was wondering are these things in the game yet or are they still coming or is it bugged?
it seems weird to advertise them on the "its live" page if they arent in the game yet tho 
could someone help me with this?
thanks :)

replies.body: Mine took a day until I could use my custom emote for mastery. when I got it I couldn't use it, I think their needs to be a higher level cap though....{{champion:8}}
It's once you get to max mastery i.e 5/5 levels.

> [{quoted}](name=TheEverydayWiz,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=AoI8NJIY,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-05-13T10:41:29.165+0000)
>
> It's once you get to max mastery i.e 5/5 levels.

you get the emote, badge, and announcement banner at rank 4. they just get better at rank 5.

apparently there are a few bugs and stuff to work out with champion mastery not working properly

Custom emote is when you're in game, you can press CTRL + 6 to show what mastery level you are (only you and your teammates can see it)
Loading screen badge appears on the top left hand side in the loading screen IIRC

[This is what it looks like](http://puu.sh/hLDQA/7961912b05.jpg)
